abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Power Sector Efficiency Project in
            Indonesia. The overall objective of the project was to
            improve the economic, technical and institutional efficiency
            of the power sector. Overall, the Bank's performance
            has been satisfactory. Borrower’s performance was
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            experience with the captive power and energy pricing
            covenants indicates that, to be effective, covenants should
            be (a) realistic, (b) dated, (c) backed up by research and
            action plans, and (d) systematically pursued and reviewed;
            (ii) establishment of a central Project Management Unit
            (PMU) could benefit overall project coordination and
            accountability; (iii) well-targeted technical assistance
            programs can be very productive; (iv) there was no regular
            performance monitoring during supervision; and (v)
            cumbersome procurement processes were a leading cause of
            project implementation delays.
